{"step_by_step_thinking": "Benzoyl peroxide is a common initiator in the polymerization of acrylic resin. It decomposes to form free radicals, which then initiate the polymerization process. The decomposition of benzoyl peroxide is a temperature-dependent process. At room temperature (around 25°C), it is stable and does not decompose. The decomposition starts at a higher temperature, typically above 60°C.", "answer_choice": "D. 60°C"}
